creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: pallette is predominanty beige, grey, white and green; two white birds at bottom of panels 2 and 4; grey bird in tree in panel 3; owl in tree in panel 6 and a few other birds; painting on back of screen also
inscription: RE: {Saishiki kacho shugetsu hitsu}; Left: {Saishiki kacho shugetsu hitsu} (Coloured bird and flower painted by Shugetsu (Yasunobu authenticates painting as to be by Shugetsu, immediately prior to his own signature.) xx xx bird and flower painted by shugetsu)
object_name: Six-panel folding screen, one of a pair
signed: RE: {Saishiki kacho shugetsu hitsu/hogan yasunobu]; Left: [Saishiki kacho shugetsu hitsu/hogan yasunobu}
text: On the right screen, a horned owl in a pine tree watches hawks chase herons at the edge of a lotus pond. On the left screen, cranes, ducks, and other birds are dispersed among plum, bamboo, reed, and hibiscus. An inscription by the painter Kanō Yasunobu (1613–1685) assigns this pair to Shūgetsu Tōkan; on the other side is a painting of pine trees on gold leaf by Yasunobu. (2013.29.20.1-.2)
title: Birds in Landscape [right of a pair]
